sentence.Network_en: Priestly robes hang on the walls.
His Indian robes contrasted oddly with his fluent English.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的印度长袍与他流利的英语形成奇特的对照.

entry.def: A robe is a loose piece of clothing which covers all of your body and reaches the ground. You can describe someone as wearing a robe or as wearing robes .

example.ex: Pope John Paul II knelt in his white robes before the simple altar.
example.tran: 教皇约翰·保罗二世身着白色长袍在简朴的圣坛前面跪下来。
毛皮衬里的绿色丝绸长袍

entry.def: A robe is a piece of clothing, usually made of towelling, which people wear in the house, especially when they have just got up or had a bath.

example.ex: Ryle put on a robe and went down to the kitchen.
example.tran: 赖尔穿上睡袍，下楼去了厨房。
